name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 16, a Weilai employee posted a message saying that in order to keep his job and get promoted, he bought two Weilai cars under the explicit and implicit instructions of his boss, and also encouraged his relatives to buy two cars, but in the end he still could not escape the fate of being laid off. Now not only was he laid off, but he also had to bear a monthly car loan of more than 10,000 yuan. He also revealed that he often worked overtime in the company, stayed up all night, never received overtime pay, and had many problems with his car.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Patriots, please pay attention
Currently, mentioning "anti-American" on Weibo is considered to be a violation of laws and regulations.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 16, McGill University in Canada issued a notice to all students, prohibiting the use of WeChat on school devices, including connecting to school WIFI.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 16, the Xinjiang Production and Construction Corps Second Division Justice Bureau released a video on Douyin: Citizens of the People's Republic of China have freedom of speech, association, procession, publication, assembly, and demonstration.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 17, in Chentougang, Shibi Street, Panyu District, Guangzhou, the local government ignored the opposition of the masses and forced to build a power plant 400 meters near the community, which triggered protests from the masses.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 16, the media reported that Blackstone Group was selling off 11 logistics parks in China.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Guangzhou Panyu veterans group
Someone is recruiting veterans to go to Hong Kong to work as auxiliary police and security guards
25,000 yuan per month including food and accommodation.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
November 17, Shenyang
Zhongzhi investors protested in front of the Bank of China demanding repayment of their money

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: In Lanzhou, Gansu, the government has been demolishing houses for 15 years, but has not built houses or paid transition fees. No one cares about it, which has led to the gradual poverty of most elderly people due to long-term consumption. They went to the Municipal Bureau of Letters and Calls to defend their rights. An 80-year-old man cried: "The government has made us suffer." He said that he originally had 15 houses, but now his family has scattered everywhere to find cheap houses to rent, just like his family has been broken up.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
[The darkest moment for anti-Japanese patriots] On November 17, Xi Jinping met with Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and said that China and Japan coexist peacefully and friendship from generation to generation is in the fundamental interests of the people of both countries. 
At the same time, he did not express any opposition when mentioning the incident of Japan's discharge of nuclear waste water, saying that Japan should properly handle it in a responsible and constructive manner. 
In September this year, under the guidance of all official media, the incident of Japan's discharge of nuclear waste water triggered a large-scale anti-Japanese wave on the domestic Internet, and some people even took to the streets to block roads in protest.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On November 17, the media reported that a man died suddenly after vomiting blood on his way out of the workshop to eat after working 23 consecutive days at Qunzhi Optoelectronics Co., Ltd. in Foshan, Guangdong Province.
However, the company and the Human Resources and Social Security Bureau of Nanhai District, Foshan City determined that the man’s death was not a work-related injury because it occurred at a non-working time and place.
The man’s family was dissatisfied with this decision and filed an administrative review, but the Nanhai District Government upheld the original decision.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On November 16, the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the National Supervisory Commission announced that Zhou Yuqing, vice president of the China Development Bank, was expelled from the party, his illegal gains were confiscated, and he was transferred to the procuratorate.
In addition to engaging in power-for-money transactions and illegally accepting huge amounts of money, there were also problems such as "privately retaining confidential documents and reading books and periodicals with serious political issues".

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Another student death during a college physical test in China
On November 17, a student at Zhejiang Gongshang University Law School fell to the ground during a 1,000-meter physical test and reportedly died of choking due to vomit stuck in his throat.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 16, the media reported that a man in Xi'an called to complain, but his personal information was leaked by the market supervision. The person being reported directly sent the report ticket to him.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 17, Jiangsu Economic and Trade Vocational and Technical College (Jiangning Campus) in Nanjing, Jiangsu Province, reported that the school's tuition and fees were unevenly distributed. Students reported that some received around 600-800 yuan, while others received nothing. This caused dissatisfaction among students, who cursed in the group chat.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: The paper has been removed from the shelves

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Media research has confirmed that the APEC positions are arranged in alphabetical order according to the country's first letters.
